message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.GR 

This paper proposes a method to improve classification networks using a Three-Player Generative Adversarial Network. The method involves introducing a competition between the generator and the classifier to synthesize samples that are both realistic and hard to label for the classifier. This approach is evaluated on a public dataset for traffic sign recognition, which falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The use of GANs and machine learning techniques to improve classification networks suggests that this paper could also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE) sub-categories. Additionally, the use of competition and game theory in the proposed method could also make it relevant to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category.
